ygData.subject: Re: weapon choices at 17th level (was: taking the ghoulbane  plunge)
ygData.msgSnippet: Okay, I shot over to everquest.gamestats.com - it tells me that the BIBS is on a dazed goblin knight in runnyeye, near the purple crystals. Would I be able to
ygData.messageBody:
Okay, I shot over to everquest.gamestats.com - it tells me that the BIBS is on a
dazed goblin knight in runnyeye, near the purple crystals. Would I be able to
survive taking a team of 1-17th lvl paladin, 1-20th lvl wizard, and 1-19th lvl
cleric into runnyeye to try and find these purple crystals, then find the
knight, then kill the knight? I usually don't hang out in Runnyeye, I do run
thru there when I make a journey from Freeport to Qeynos. Any directions from
the entryway would be MUCH appreciated :)

Again, thanks for all the feedback folks!
Kaladin, the brave adventurous 17th level Paladin

Paul Duquette wrote:

> From: "Paul Duquette" <PDuquette@...>
>
> My BIBS has served me extremely well since 20th lvl. You might want to go to
> runnyeye and get one fer yourself.
>
> Perry 29th dwarven Pally.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Gary Long <glong@...>
> To: <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
> Sent: Thursday, September 23, 1999 12:14 PM
> Subject: [eqpaladin] weapon choices at 17th level (was: taking the ghoulbane
> plunge)
>
> > From: Gary Long <glong@...>
> >
> > This has been an interesting and informative thread, I'm glad I started
> it!
> > Consensus seems to be that:
> > A) Wait until you get past level 25 before even trying to get the sword,
> > B) Ghoulbane is extremely hard to get even at lvl 30 and above,
> > C) There are more appropriate weapons that I should be using until I hit
> > over level 25.
> >
> > Seems like for us honest 17th thru 25th level Paladins our weapon choices
> > are pretty clear:
> > 1. combine longsword or scimitar / shiny brass shield
> > 2. shiny brass halberd
> > 3. hammer of wrath / shiny brass shield
> > ...with the nod going to the shiny brass halberd at level 20.
> >
> > I *like* the way bash interrupts spells, and would regret not being able
> to
> > use it for 5 or more levels. If I switch to a shiny brass halberd then I
> am
> > walking away from 1-handed slashing skill which will need to be made up
> > after I do get ghoulbane.
> >
> > Are there any other weapon/shield combos I am overlooking that actually
> > worked for some of you more accomplished Paladins?
> >
> > Again, thanks everybody for the input.
> > Kaladin, 17th level Paladin (who is not well known for hiding in safe
> > corners of Norrath)
> >
> > Nicholas20@... wrote:
> >
> > > From: Nicholas20@...
> > >
> > > True the druid can "sneak" the paladin down and the paladin can "hide"
> in the "safe" corner while his friends do the work and then hand him a
> weapon he did nothing to earn, but any paladin worth a grain of salt who
> uses these techniques I don't feel they deserve one. First of all there is a
> sort of honor arranging the group, leading it in, and having an active party
> > > work together with you contributing. Who needs it at lvl 17 anyways? You
> won't do max dmg till 20 and the effect won't work as well. There are many
> other fine weapons out there till then. Second of all in my experience
> camping this thing, it can go bad very quick..people say you can stay in one
> room safely and keep a couple spawns controlled, but if you really want to
> live keep the whole area clean. Trust me it goes much better this way. Some
> people get lucky and get the sword right away..that has never been my
> experience as it is still not something I have obtained and i have tried
> many times. It's a long camp but it will be well worth it if you earn it.
> > > Shakel Ana'key
> > > Tarrew Marr
> > > Paladin of the 35th rank (still has yet to get that blasted sword)
> > >
> > >
> > --

> >
